intro: Oxydectes elliottii, commonly known as Elliott's oxydectes, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features slender, branching stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
